title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Yaseen M, Eskridge KM (2018). stability: Stability Analysis Genotype Environment Interaction (GEI).
code: @Manual{,   title = {stability: Stability Analysis of Genotype by Environment Interaction (GEI)},   author = {Muhammad Yaseen and Kent M. Eskridge},   year = {2018},   journal = {The Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN)}, }

previous_headings: stability: Stability Analysis of Genotype by Environment Interaction (GEI)
what: Muhammad Yaseen1,2, and Kent M. Eskridge3
title: stability
text: School Mathematical & Statistical Sciences, Clemson University, Clemson, South Carolina, USA Department Mathematics Statistics, University Agriculture Faisalabad, Pakistan Department Statistics, University Nebraska Lincoln, NE, USA   ***

title: stability
text: Provides functionalities performing stability analysis genotype environment interaction (GEI) identify superior stable genotypes across diverse environments. implements Eberhart Russell’s ANOVA method (1966)(doi:10.2135/cropsci1966.0011183X000600010011x>), Finlay Wilkinson’s Joint Linear Regression method (1963) (<doi:10.1071/AR9630742>), Wricke’s Ecovalence (1962, 1964), Shukla’s stability variance parameter (1972) (<doi:10.1038/hdy.1972.87>), Kang’s simultaneous selection high yield stability (1991) (<doi:10.2134/agronj1991.00021962008300010037x, Finlay Wilkinson’s Joint Linear Regression method (1963) (doi:10.1071/AR9630742), Wricke’s Ecovalence (1962, 1964), Shukla’s stability variance parameter (1972) (doi:10.1038/hdy.1972.87), Kang’s simultaneous selection high yield stability (1991) (<doi:10.2134/agronj1991.00021962008300010037x)), Additive Main Effects Multiplicative Interaction (AMMI) method Genotype plus Genotypes Environment (GGE) Interaction methods.

title: stability
text: package can installed CRAN follows: development version can installed github follows:

title: Additive ANOVA for Genotypes by Environment Interaction (GEI) model — add_anova
code: data(ge_data) YieldANOVA <-      add_anova(             .data = ge_data           , .y    = Yield           , .rep  = Rep           , .gen  = Gen           , .env  = Env       ) YieldANOVA #> $anova #> Analysis of Variance Table #>  #> Response: .data[[Y]] #>            Df    Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)     #> Env        10 263940496 26394050 68.0551 1.995e-08 *** #> Rep(Env)   11   4266167   387833                       #> Gen        59  71662431  1214617 12.2482 < 2.2e-16 *** #> Gen:Env   590 201336476   341248  3.4411 < 2.2e-16 *** #> Residuals 649  64359568    99167                       #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>

Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
text: Performs stability analysis based criteria              Fox et al. (1990), using statistical "TOP third" .              Fox function, stratified ranking genotypes              environment separately done. proportion locations              genotype occurred top third expressed              TOP output.

title: Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
text: .data data.frame .y Response Variable .rep Replication Factor .gen Genotypes Factor .env Environment Factor

title: Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
text: Fox, P.N. Skovmand, B.  Thompson, B.K.  Braun, H.J. Cormier, R. (1990). Yield adaptation hexaploid spring triticale. Euphytica,  47, 57-64.

title: Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
text: Muhammad Yaseen (myaseen208@gmail.com) Kent M. Edkridge (keskridge1@unl.edu)

title: Stability Fox Function — stab_fox
Stability Kang Function — stab_kang
text: Performs stability analysis based Kang (1988)              criteria. Kang nonparametric stability (ranksum) uses              "trait single value" stability variance (Shukla, 1972),              genotype lowest ranksum commonly favorable one.

title: Stability Kang Function — stab_kang
Stability Kang Function — stab_kang
text: .data data.frame .y Response Variable .rep Replication Factor .gen Genotypes Factor .env Environment Factor

title: Stability Kang Function — stab_kang
text: Kang, M.S.  (1988). rank-sum method selecting high-yielding, stable corn genotypes. Cereal Research Communications,  16, 1-2. Shukla, G.K.  (1972). aspects partitioning genotype environmental components variability. Heredity,  29, 237-245.

title: Stability Kang Function — stab_kang
text: Muhammad Yaseen (myaseen208@gmail.com) Kent M. Edkridge (keskridge1@unl.edu)

what: Stability Analysis of Genotype by Environment Interaction (GEI) — stability
title: Stability Analysis of Genotype by Environment Interaction (GEI) — stability
text: stability package provides functionalities perform Stability Analysis Genotype Environment Interaction (GEI) identify superior stable genotypes diverse environments. performs  Eberhart & Russel's ANOVA (1966), Finlay Wilkinson (1963) Joint Linear Regression, Wricke (1962, 1964) Ecovalence, Shukla's stability variance parameter (1972)  Kang's (1991) simultaneous selection high yielding stable parameter.

title: Stability Analysis of Genotype by Environment Interaction (GEI) — stability
text: Muhammad Yaseen (myaseen208@gmail.com) Kent M. Edkridge (keskridge1@unl.edu)
